page.title: 09Yaldens Farm, Eversley
page.content: {Yaldens Farm}was mentioned in the Domesday Book. The{Parsons family}have been running the farm for forty years but before that it was owned by someone else. The crops the Parsons grow are potatoes, corn, kale (which they feed to the guinea fowl) and maize, barley, wheat and oats. The Parsons own eleven acres at Yaldens and another farm of two hundred acres. The animals on the farm are very varied. They have ten ewes, fourteen lambs and a very successful breed of pigs called Searchlight. There are a lot of different kinds of poultry including hens, ducks, geese and guinea fowl. Some of them they sell and some they keep for eggs.{Yaldens {Farm}is a family farm which everyone in the family helps to run.
